intro: Lodicularia, commonly known as the water clover, is a genus of aquatic plants belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae. These plants are characterized by their delicate, ribbon-like leaves that float on the water surface or hang submerged. Lodicularia species are known for their ability to absorb nutrients from the water, contributing to water purification. They also provide habitat and shelter for various aquatic organisms.
